instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: 820-000165 only works on battery
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had mild water damage, primary in dc in area. Using a known good cable and dc in board but have no light. When ac adapter is plugged in backlight comes on for a few seconds and then turns off however if unplugged with just battery backlight stays on along with question mark folder.

<CHIP>U4500</CHIP> also had mild water damage but do not believe that is the cause of the problem.

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.42V

what to check next?

threads.title: 820-000165 only works on battery
threads.message:
Does it start in SMC bypass mode?
Do you get amber light with charger, no battery?
Check SCL/SDA lines on battery bus; diode mode to ground and voltage too.
Check J9500 for corrosion and be sure to have good solders.
Post voltage at pins 9 & 15 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Check exact value for <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/52.

threads.title: 820-000165 only works on battery
threads.message:
yes starts in SMC bypass mode and backlight doesn't go out

no light whatsoever with or without battery

can you specify what I am looking for when you say check SCL/SDA lines on battery bus? Not sure where to measure for diode mode to ground and voltages

Already fixed J9500 solders and cleaned up corrosion

pin 9 1.435V  pin 15 0.80V

<RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> 11

<RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> 2.8 R751 2 .4

threads.title: 820-000165 only works on battery
threads.message:
"can you specify what I am looking for when you say check SCL/SDA lines on battery bus?"
Check at pins 4 & 5 of J6950.

Disconnect LIO flex and test the board without battery (just charger), only DC cable connected from LIO board.

Post exact value (measured onboard, ohm scale) for <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86.

threads.title: 820-000165 only works on battery
threads.message:
J6950 pin 4 3.4V pin 5 3.4V

diode mode pin 4 .499 pin 5 .498

<RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR> 99.85 <RESISTOR>R7181</RESISTOR> 61.6

<RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR> .473  <RESISTOR>R7186</RESISTOR> 330.9

threads.title: 820-000165 only works on battery
threads.message:
"no light whatsoever with or without battery"
So no MagSafe light at all?
Did you try a known good LIO board/flex?

"pin 9 1.435V"
That is too high.
SMC is informed about 8.5A drawn from charger.
Are you sure about <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 value?.
Measure resistance directly between pins 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: 820-000165 only works on battery
threads.message:
Yes using a known good LIO board/flex. No magsafe light at all

Should the isl be replaced since pin 9 is too high??

yes sure about <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 Value. Just measured again and <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> starts at 11 and drops to 10.7, same for <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR>

Pins 27/28   21 resistance

threads.title: 820-000165 only works on battery
threads.message: You have an issue with J9500 it seems based on the information you gave. Can you upload a good picture of J9500 mainly pins 19-29? Seems like pins 21 and 27 have issues at minimum.

threads.title: 820-000165 only works on battery
threads.message: Post <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> voltage with charger only.

threads.title: 820-000165 only works on battery
threads.message: Check for continuity from pins 21 and 27 to the rest of the board.
